musicalLanguage.description: Henry Mancini's dreamy waltz from Breakfast at Tiffany's is one of the most beloved film melodies. The wide opening interval (C to A, a major sixth) immediately establishes the song's yearning character. The simple C major harmony and gentle 3/4 waltz make this accessible for beginners, while the melody's beauty rewards even the simplest performance.
musicalLanguage.structure: A section: the wide-interval melody over C-Am-F-G (4 bars), B section: melodic development and return (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bar 1: The opening leap from C to A — the most famous interval in film music.
Bars 3-4: F major to G — the classic IV-V waltz motion.
Bar 8: Return to C — dreamy resolution, like moonlight on water.
teachingGoals: Wide melodic intervals — the opening sixth requires confident leaping
3/4 waltz feel at a slow, dreamy tempo
Simple left hand waltz accompaniment pattern
styleTips: Dreamy and floating — like moonlight on a river
The opening leap should feel natural, not effortful
Left hand waltz pattern: bass-chord-chord, very gentle

measures.teachingNote: C major — the iconic leap from C to A. Moon River begins.
Am — descending melody. Each note gently falls like a sigh.
F major — melody climbs stepwise. Hopeful and tender.
G major — dotted half note. Let it ring through the whole bar.
C major — the leap returns. Same magic, second time.
F major — a different descent this time. More intimate.
G major — gentle ascent preparing the final resolution.
C major — dotted half note C. Moon River at rest. Peaceful.
